Quiz.Question: Multiple inheritance means
Quiz.OptionA: (a) one class inheriting from more super classes
Quiz.OptionB: (b) more classes inheriting from one super class
Quiz.OptionC: (c) more classes inheriting from more super classes

Quiz.Question: Which statement is not true in java language
Quiz.OptionA: (a) A public member of a class can be accessed in all the packages.
Quiz.OptionB: (b) A private member of a class cannot be accessed by the methods of the same class.
Quiz.OptionC: (c) A private member of a class cannot be accessed from its derived class.
Quiz.OptionD: (d) A protected member of a class can be accessed from its derived class.

Quiz.Question: To prevent any method from overriding, we declare the method as,
Which one of the following is not true?
Quiz.OptionA: (a) A class containing abstract methods is called an abstract class.
Quiz.OptionB: (b) Abstract methods should be implemented in the derived class.
Quiz.OptionC: (c) An abstract class cannot have non-abstract methods.
Quiz.OptionD: (d) A class must be qualified as ‘abstract’ class, if it contains one abstract method.

Quiz.Question: The fields in an interface are implicitly specified as,
Which of the following is not true?
Quiz.OptionA: (a) An interface can extend another interface.
Quiz.OptionB: (b) A class which is implementing an interface must implement all the methods of the interface.
Quiz.OptionC: (c) An interface can implement another interface.
Quiz.OptionD: (d) An interface is a solution for multiple inheritance in java.
